Detailed Description

Host Driver: Implementation of Octeon input queues.

Function Documentation

int octeon_delete_instr_queue ( octeon_device_t *  octeon_dev,
int  iq_no 
)

octeon_delete_instr_queue()

Parameters:
octeon_dev - pointer to the octeon device structure.
iq_no - queue to be deleted (0 <= q_no <= 3).
Called at driver unload time for each input queue. Deletes all allocated resources for the input queue.

Returns:
Success: 0 Failure: 1

void octeon_flush_iq ( octeon_device_t *  oct,
octeon_instr_queue_t *  iq 
)

API exported so that modules like octeon NIC module can flush the input queue to which they had posted a command before.

Parameters:
oct - octeon device pointer
iq - pointer to the octeon device input queue that will be flushed

int octeon_init_instr_queue ( octeon_device_t *  octeon_dev,
int  iq_no 
)

octeon_init_instr_queue()

Parameters:
octeon_dev - pointer to the octeon device structure.
octeon_iq_conf - configuration parameters for this input queue.
iq_no - queue to be initialized (0 <= q_no <= 3).
Called at driver init time for each input queue. iq_conf has the configuration parameters for the queue.

Returns:
Success: 0 Failure: 1

int octeon_iq_post_command ( octeon_device_t *  oct,
octeon_instr_queue_t *  iq,
uint32_t  force_db,
void *  cmd 
)

API exported to other modules that want to post a command directly into the Input queue.

This way of sending a command to Octeon does not provide for notification of completion or for a callback. Most modules will not use this.

Parameters:
oct - octeon device pointer
iq - pointer to the input queue to which the command is posted
force_db - flag indicating if the input queue doorbell should be rung after this command is posted.
cmd - pointer to the 32-byte command structure.
